title: Trace: Missing Attribute or Method
story: Code that tries to call a method that doesn't exist on an object will raise an AttributeError. Learning to read these traces helps debug object-oriented code.
instructions: Read the stack trace and code, then diagnose the attribute error.

hints.text: AttributeError means the object doesn't have the attribute or method you tried to access.
Check the object type - maybe you're calling a method that doesn't exist on that type.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 3, in <module>
    numbers.add(4)
AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'add'

questions.question: Which method doesn't exist on the list object?
What is the correct method to add an item to a list?
